title: Ollydbg: Function name list like in IDA
content: I'm new with reverse engineering and especially with Ollydbg, I have little experience with IDA and currently trying to get used to Olly. My questions are: 1.Is there any window which would show function list like in IDA? To be more spesific here is what I'm talking about . How to bring such window in Olly? 2. During investigation if I jump into some function(static analysis) how to get back? I mean is there anything that has same functionality as these keys do? Sorry if questions sound silly I'm new with this stuff. thanks :)

comments.text: for the 1st question reverseengineering.stackexchange.com/questions/9169/â€¦ , for the 2nd use callstack

answers_data.content:
1 Ctrl +n or right click view names / view intermodular calls

2 ctrl+ or ctrl - to jump back and forth.

Or open shortcut editor in ollydbg v2 and set your favorite shortcut for navigation
